text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commission" means the Maryland Home Improvement Commission.
"Contractor" means a person, other than an employee of an owner, who performs or offers or agrees to perform a home improvement for an owner.
"Contractor license" means a license issued by the Commission to act as a contractor.
"Fund" means the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund.
"Hearing board" means a home improvement hearing board appointed by the Commission under § 8-313 of this title.

section.section:
"Home improvement" means:
the addition to or alteration, conversion, improvement, modernization, remodeling, repair, or replacement of a building or part of a building that is used or designed to be used as a residence or dwelling place or a structure adjacent to that building; or
an improvement to land adjacent to the building.

text.section: "Home improvement contract" means an oral or written agreement between a contractor and owner for the contractor to perform a home improvement.

section.section: "License" means, except where it refers to a license other than one issued under this title, a license issued by the Commission.

"License" includes:
a contractor license;
a subcontractor license; and
a salesperson license.

text.section: "Licensed contractor" means a person who is licensed by the Commission to act as a contractor.
"Owner" includes a homeowner, tenant, or other person who buys, contracts for, orders, or is entitled to a home improvement.
"Salesperson" means a person who sells a home improvement.
"Salesperson license" means a license issued by the Commission to sell a home improvement.

"Sell a home improvement" means:
to negotiate or offer to negotiate a home improvement contract with an owner; or
to seek to get a home improvement contract from an owner.

"Subcontractor" means a person, other than a laborer or supplier of materials, who makes an oral or written agreement with:
a contractor to perform all or part of a home improvement contract; or
another subcontractor to perform all or part of a subcontract to a home improvement contract.
"Subcontractor license" means a license issued by the Commission to act as a subcontractor.
